result.execSummary:
The defendant Anna M Zierfus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Count. Amphetamine (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(2)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts
parties.address: 333 Vine St, Room 1200, La Crosse, WI 54601

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Complete a Mental Health evaluation and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Sign all necessary Releases of Information
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with users or traffickers of illicit drugs or controlled substances
.

Take all prescribed medications as directed

Pay restitution of $2000 (owed in 15CM396) - a Restitution Hearing can be set if the amount is disputed

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to the DA's office (see 'other' above)

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment

Complete any other conditions or treatment deemed necessary by the PO

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 136 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
Can be served on Electronic Monitoring with Justice Support Services

Unpaid Court financial obligations are converted to a Civil Judgment
.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to La Crosse Co case 16CM1435
.
